website_summaries.verdict: This compact monitor boasts an impressive 1 millisecond response time and full HD resolution, making it a good gaming monitor for users who need a unit that will fit in a small space.
pros: Fits in smaller spaces such as dorm room, bedroom or apartment environments
The 1 millisecond response time means lag is almost nonexistent, and the refresh rate can go up to 144 hertz, so graphics do not blur
HD resolution means colors are reproduced accurately and vividly
cons: Users may experience the occasional dead or stuck pixel, especially with frequent or extended monitor use

customer_reviews.title: Amazing 4k Gaming Monitor
customer_reviews.text: If you have a 2080ti and are in the market for a 4k monitor this monitor is absolutely gorgeous. I really don't understand the complaints of backlight bleeding from the AMD sister of this the XV273K but I see no backlight bleed at all on this panel even at max nits. I have seen the price fluctuate and some sales on this monitor so if the current price of $1249 is a bit steep maybe a price drop will occur in the near future but I absolutely think this monitor is worth the price. Stunning.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Still the same firmware problem for two years.
customer_reviews.text: I received a monitor that still has the issue with the screen splitting down the middle. I was hoping I would be all set, it was stamped as being manufactured in February 2018 and assumed they would hav fixed this issue by now as it has been prevalent since 2016. Shame on Acer for this, picture quality was great when the screen wasn't malfunctioning too. I was not willing to take chances and have it replaced. Amazon was awesome as always about me returning the item. I decided on a different monitor, and am much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan N

customer_reviews.title: DO. NOT. BUY.
customer_reviews.text: Display does not work with gsync on. The display crashes and flickers constantly if you try to use gysnc at all. I've received 1 replacement from amazon and sent it into acer TWICE and had it "repaired". It still flickers when trying to use gysnc. Just google "XB321HK flickering" and you'll find tons of forum posts and users experiencing the same issue. It's clear the 32" panel has manufacturing flaws and acer is just dragging their feet until everyone's warranty runs out.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Lee

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: Brings the best specs at a more a affordable price than the X27. They seem to have solved the fan noise issue by including a special bracket with extra room for airflow if you mount it to a monitor arm. I never hear the fan. The only issue I see is that when the monitor goes dark there is quite a bit of light bleeding in each of the corners, but I don't notice it otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: 4k wont work with ps4 pro, xbox one x or many laptops with HDMI only.
customer_reviews.text: I really wish I knew this before buying the monitor and now it's too late to return. 4k60p is only supported over DisplayPort, which is OK for single PC use, but useless for connecting a PS4 PRO or Xbox One X. It also introduces issues for some laptops, since displayport is not always supported. Lastly, it's also annoying since I like to use a switch to switch between my laptop and my PC (using the same monitor), but lack of HDMI 4k60p support makes this difficult. The best I can get out of my 2017 Macbook Pro is 4k 15Hz, which is unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan T.

customer_reviews.title: Vertical tearing
customer_reviews.text: The screen works great, aside from the 1-3 times a day when a blob of vertically oriented colors ripples across a section of the screen. I have two of these and one does indeed have the vertical tearing issue so many others have mentioned. EDIT: About a year into ownership and I'm getting the black flashing screen of death on both monitors I purchased. Acer will not honor their warranty and will not pay for shipping for their defective monitors. Let this be a lesson I had to pay for you - swear off Acer products for life. They are not worth the high price charged.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Damaged on arrival (at least I HOPE this is damage)
customer_reviews.text: If the product wasn't damaged I'd give a decent score but alas I can't. The power port is incredibly fickle. 1 slight tap to the power cable and the whole screen goes off. At least I hope it's broken, who knows if they all come like this. Outside of that it's a decent monitor but it's infuriating anytime I slightly bump my desk I have to fight with my monitor to get it turned back on. Have had it close to a year now and the issue persists no matter how much try to get it to stay in perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Shayne

customer_reviews.title: Great picture although with some problems
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1. Excellent picture (very high resolution, dark blacks, wide dynamic range) 2. Lots of ports Cons: 1. Initially the monitor blinks out for 1 to 3 seconds every few minutes. Now rarely since switching to a cheaper Display port cable and moving all other cables away from the area. (Reading message boards this is a common problem with this model despite having updated to the latest drivers) 2. Expensive
customer_reviews.author: DrBiff

customer_reviews.title: Avoid the 32" monitor
customer_reviews.text: When I first got this monitor I loved it: great design and picture quality. However, after a few weeks, I began to suffer from the vertical line pop-in issue that several people here have been complaining about. Vertical lines would briefly pop up on the screen at random. This defect is known to Acer but it still isn't fixed years after it was first discovered. I don't want to take the chance at exchanging it and getting another defective monitor so I am returning this and buying a different model.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Urban

customer_reviews.title: needs driver support ?
customer_reviews.text: monitor could be great,but its not.no drivers available for win10 that I am aware of or could find. monitor flashes on and off upon start up 5 or 6 times and nvidia control panel takes a minute to kick in. color sliders do not work at all in nvidia panel and upon exiting and entering game nvidia panel is disabled and or defaulted to factory setting and you have to re enter n/panel to reactivate.i believe this is all caused from drivers but not sure.cannot chance it at this price ...returned I have no issues at all with nvidia control panel with any other monitors I own
customer_reviews.author: guydodge

customer_reviews.title: What is not to like about the Acer Predator XB321HK
customer_reviews.text: Oh ya it rocks, tested games, graphics and other odd and wacky things. It is a champion. I tried the 35 widescreen version with high refresh rate, it was nice however I preferred this large 4k monitors with G sync. Smooth gaming and very nice color. It is not quite a professional level color balance, however it solid and I am person who is very fussy about color balance on my monitors. I was after a large 4k monitors with G sync and great color out of the box, and this had it all.
customer_reviews.author: Anicra

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful, but flawed
customer_reviews.text: The monitor is beautiful and well-constructed. The stand is heavy duty and adjusts height well. The monitor falls short in two places: 1. There are only two inputs, one each hdmi and displayport. 2. The monitor is rated at 4k, but will only do 30hz at that resolution because it is rated as hdmi 1.4 and not 2.x. Regardless of Acer's claims, it's simply not going to be compatible with some manufacturers (e.g. Apple!).
customer_reviews.author: M. F. Daumen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor! terrible UI
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is great! excellent quality all around. beefy stand. my only problem is that the UI to change anything is heinous to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Brett McCoy

customer_reviews.title: Had to use the warranty right off the bat...
customer_reviews.text: Well, I had to use the warranty right off the bat, shipped to Texas on my dime and was out a monitor for a few weeks. I only sent in the monitor. If you have to RMA do not send in the original box, if you do only send the screen, you may only get back the screen and you will not get the box. I had a box for a fan shroud for my truck and sent it in that. Cost me about $80 to send it in insured. Parts weren't available and was sent what looks like a new replacement. It's a great monitor when it works. Hopefully, I won't have to send it back.
customer_reviews.author: Rice

customer_reviews.title: Defective right out of the box!
customer_reviews.text: I got this to replace my old Acer GD235HZ which got blown up in a power surge after 7 years of good service. I thought I would try this one out and it was bad right out of the box. The text looks funky, there's constant flickering, there's also some weird streaks that are embedded into the actual screen. You can't see them on bright backgrounds but on darker backgrounds, they're glaringly obvious and ruin everything. The on-screen menu is horrendous and very annoying to use. I am surprised they set this up to be so user-unfriendly. I am going to try my luck with a different brand. Thankfully Amazon has a righteous hassle-free return policy. So back this goes!
customer_reviews.author: Turd Ferguson

customer_reviews.title: Wish I could return it
customer_reviews.text: USB hub stops working over night. That didn't happen on my last monitor. The screen goes black every once in a while. Probably happens 10-20 times a day. I assume it has to do with g-sync. If I would have paid full price I would have returned it. It also has a stuck pixel that won't recover. Not a huge deal since it's 4k though. Update: The screen blinking has increased in frequency. Only happens when G-sync is on. Its really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Jake1987

customer_reviews.title: i had 32" inch 4K VA panel monitor previously but this ACER XB321HK is Way better. all VA monitors are much worse compared to ...
customer_reviews.text: Superb Monitor, mine is manufactured in 2018 and i see no backlight/flickering issues at all. i had 32" inch 4K VA panel monitor previously but this ACER XB321HK is Way better. all VA monitors are much worse compared to ips type displays, TEXT was horrible on LG UB59-B while on ACER XB321HK it is crystal clear + G-Sync is best with 4K displays because you will have 40-60 FPS range on modern games anyway with High End Nvidia Cards.

customer_reviews.title: Not 4 K XBOX compatible
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these monitors only to find out they use a HDMI 1.0 instead of a 2.0 so 4 k video is not possible on the HDMI connector the other Display port connector has 4 k all day but the Manufacturer should make sure this is not a XBOX 1 X friendly monitor
customer_reviews.author: Tim Dyer

customer_reviews.title: Clearing up some misconceptions.
customer_reviews.text: I just got this monitor today (keep that in mind.) It's my first G-sync monitor and it runs smoothly. it's pretty to look at even if the stand is a little tacky, and the built in speakers are terrible, and you shouldn't use them. When watching reviews about this monitor, every source said it would require minimal calibration. That is not true, out of the box, the colors are far too washed out, and it requires calibration on the software and hardware side of things.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick sloan

customer_reviews.title: the coolest part is how massive the stand is
customer_reviews.text: like seriously this stand is so cool. It's so big and you can like turn the whole screen upside down?!??!???! Is this real life??!???!?!?! The stand is just so sturdy you could probably attach a 10lb dumbbell to the top and it would still be ROCK SOLID. The part of the stand that sits on whatever surface (AND I MEAN WHATEVER SURFACE, YOU CAN SET THIS THING ON ANYTHING YOU WANT AND THE STAND WILL HOLD IT RIGHT THERE!) you put it on is rock solid metal. Plus its red painted rock solid metal which ups the coolness factor to zerocool levels. Ooh yeaaaa, would buy again just for the stand.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: Great 4k monitor, but 60hz
customer_reviews.text: I got this monitor thinking it was 144hz because this was posted on the product page. It is not. It is a 60hz monitor. Just be aware of that. It is 4k, however. There aren't many monitors which are 4k@144hz. To choose refresh over resolution is a debate not to be had here since that is a personal preference. The picture is nice, it does G-Sync proper up to the 60 and if you're ok with that, and your system can handle it, this is a fine monitor.
customer_reviews.author: zipadyduda

customer_reviews.title: I can't write two reviews so I'm editing the first one
customer_reviews.text: It said to review this but it just resurrects the original review. Maybe it's trying to just say I bought a second one because of how well the first one performed. The Predator line is seriously impressive to me because the nature of its swivel/swerve design was done so well for integrating with other models. I have two of them hugging a Samsung Odyssey LC32G7xT (I actually like curve holy crap) and you'd think they were meant to be used in tandem. This can occupy some genius real estate on a serious corner desk, I will try to attach a picture or two later but this monitor is what makes it possible.
customer_reviews.author: sih

customer_reviews.title: Amazing gaming monitor- but broke 2 years in
customer_reviews.text: I love this monitor and it's been stunning- however, at the 2 year mark (right when the warranty expired), it started screen tearing for any full screen video. It's still usable if I gsync it- but if you want to go above 60 frames it's a catastrophe, and if I'm paying over a THOUSAND dollars for a monitor- I'd like it to at least live more than 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: CH

customer_reviews.title: One out of two is now showing a vertical red line (stay away from this monitor)
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for a dual monitor setup, and one of them now shows a red line on the right side of the screen (picture attached) Went to Acer's website for RMA and looks like they do not pay for shipping and it won't be worth the hassle. The picture quality is good but without Acer standing behind their product it is not worth taking a chance.
customer_reviews.author: ravik

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good.
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical that I'd like an Acer product after having decades of horrible experience with their CRT monitors and laptops (IT is my income) - but so far this one pans out. The base of it is ridiculously oversized and clunky, but replacing that with a desk-mount arm solved that. Good brightness, good sharpness, and teamed with an EVGA 980ti, does well on the gaming side. Previous monitor was a slightly more expensive BENQ that start blinking the screen whenever it wanted until it was unplugged from power and back in (power off/on not fix), I got sick of that and finally pulled...for the better.
customer_reviews.author: jenksdrummer

customer_reviews.title: Defective monitor with crappy support.
customer_reviews.text: Monitor looks and feels nice but mine has been having issues with artifacting and screen tearing. Called support and they were no help at all. Paid $75 out of pocket to ship the monitor in to get fixed and they updated the firmware and sent it back to me. Needless to say the issue is still happening.
customer_reviews.author: zerakren

customer_reviews.title: Really nice monitor! Upgraded one of my home monitors for ...
customer_reviews.text: Really nice monitor! Upgraded one of my home monitors for this specifically for gaming and it made it clear that I needed a better video card! This is not the monitor's fault by any means as it was able to easily scale to resolutions that fit the performance abilities of my system at that time. Now with a nVidia 1070 card running at max resolution, this monitor performs excellently with the ability to quickly select the different modes for gaming, regular viewing and even watching videos & movies.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming Monitor!
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this monitor mainly to support my fortnite addiction. Has been flawless- no issues. My only gripe is the power light. I tear off a corner of a post-it-note and cover it because it is too bright in a dimly lit setting and catches your eye way too much. However, covering it is easy, and I don't notice it any longer. I cap my frames at 141 (in fortnite) with G-sync on, and it's perfect. Two years later still no issues.
customer_reviews.author: J. Eilers

customer_reviews.title: Excellent monitor at great competitive price point
customer_reviews.text: These are dope, I bought two. Recently picked up a 1080 TI to take advantage of G-Sync that this monitor is capable of. Easily pushing 120 FPS on PUBG and have a visually stunning gameplay. Important factors for my purchase: - Eye strain, having blue light tech is a huge plus as a developer - High FPS, I competitively play in top 0.5% of my game of choice (first person shooter) - Mounting, having VESA is a firm requirement, I was surprised to see many comparable curved monitors lacking this
customer_reviews.author: ColinP

customer_reviews.title: Received with a DEFECT!!!
customer_reviews.text: Just received this and this is how it looks when you freshly boot it up. I spend at least an hour with the manufacturer support telling me to hard reset the equipment. I don't have any proof when I called the support because red with vertical lines fades overtime. Here’s my proof now. I have another monitor just like this one for over a year now and it doesn't exhibit this problem. This 3 star is for the person who helped me for replacement from Amazon
customer_reviews.author: Yanyan

customer_reviews.title: Gaming/Photo/Video editing
customer_reviews.text: I love these monitors! I bought (2) of them. I have them overclocked to 144hz and it's an amazing display for gaming. I also color calibrated them for editing photos/videos. I drop the refresh down to 120hz when not gaming, I don't want to keep these things overclocked as it could cause hardware failure with long term use, but that's the same for anything you overclock for long periods of time.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hare

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitors - going strong
customer_reviews.text: I've had these monitors for a few years already and they've been nothing but great. Amazing quality, and back then 144HZ was considered top of the line, and even now in 2020, it feels amazing compared to other monitors I've seen. I've mounted two of these on my desk and I love using them! I have no complaints and never had problems with these - the only I issue I actually had was my movers dropping the monitors and damaging them but Amazon quickly replaced them for me.
customer_reviews.author: Sang Park

customer_reviews.title: Dead Pixel in Middle of Screen
customer_reviews.text: This monitor performed admirably and still does; however, after a little over a year, I have a stuck red pixel in the very middle of my screen. It's mildly annoying. I expect better life out of a monitor that costs $500 plus. Disappointing to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Taylor

customer_reviews.title: 180hz creates weird problem for brightness
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is excellent! However here’s Simone stuff you’d like to know before buying. If your like me then you probably didn’t know that an HDMI cable cannot use more then 60Hz. So make sure the pc your getting this for has a Display Port cable to take full advantage of the full 180Hz this monitor can provide. Yes this monitor does support up to 180Hz but you have to overclock it in the monitor screen settings. Lastly: when running on 180Hz brights gets brighter then normal and the image seems a little washed cuz it’s brighter then normal. You can fiddle with the settings for this to fix it but just thought to let ya know.
customer_reviews.author: Simon

customer_reviews.title: Its a great monitor if you have the card to run it ...
customer_reviews.text: Its a great monitor if you have the card to run it and G-sync is great, However the Speakers died on me though and I do have some artifacts randomly, so no. not worth the price of $1300. I have had this for about 10 months. I tried reaching to acer and no dice. I have had no response yet regarding these issues. support leaves a lot to be desired here. If you cant wait until big 4k monitors are mainstream go for it, otherwise Id recommend either waiting for lower prices or better technology (OLED) this is after all only 60hz. or at this point, going for a UHD TV until a better option arises.
customer_reviews.author: N Hampton

customer_reviews.title: Suprised
customer_reviews.text: It is a step-up from my 1440. I'm running a i7-9700k with a 2080 card n pushing 120 fps on high with battlefield,dying light,evil within, call of duty n more. The older games run above 120 fps... Had a few glitches like the displayport..have to use a good cord and had to adjust a few things but nothing out of the ordinary. Its not quite a 4k picture but really liking the pop I'm getting. No screen deformities. When used and set-up just out of 4k I'm hitting 165 fps on ultra high. But satisfied at 120.
customer_reviews.author: karen roche

customer_reviews.title: do not buy it!
customer_reviews.text: I dont speak english, but not recomend buy this Monitor, I spend 700 usd for "premiun monitor" and have "light leakage", Im youtuber with 150,000 suscribers and really not recomend buy you product, expensive for this?
customer_reviews.author: José Sánchez

customer_reviews.title: Flawed
customer_reviews.text: As other reviews state, this monitor is flawed. The Gsync feature can cause the monitors to flicker on and off, cause the monitor sound to suddenly stop working, and seemingly cause frame drops (That last one could be unrelated). For most purposes, it is merely a slight irritation. For esports, it is entirely unacceptable and you should look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitor!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing monitor. I bought this monitor once I upgraded to my GeForce gtx 1080 gfx card. I wanted a nice monitor for my gaming machine and I couldn't be happier with this purchase. This monitor handles everything I throw at it with ease. If you're looking for a nice 140 hz monitor to handle gaming needs or even want to use it for editing or graphics design look no further. Arrived on time with all pieces and equipment in box. Very easy install and easy to use settings. I would 100% purchase this again and would comfortably recommend this to anyone looking for a nice upgraded monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Harber

customer_reviews.title: This monitor is a great improvement to what I had previously and I am ...
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is a great improvement to what I had previously and I am extremely happy. There is one noticable issue when it comes to actually watching a show/movie on netflix. Once I put it on full screen, after about 10 seconds, the screen becomes dark and the colors are distorted, a quick move of the mouse solves the problem. I am not picky enough to say this is a make or break deal but it does prevent this review to be a full 5-star. **Update** After the initial issue with the dark screen I have not encountered the problem again. I'm switching my review to 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: Dead Pixels at 10 months
customer_reviews.text: The monitor has been great for 10 months. It wasn't QUTIE worth the money but it was good enough to keep it. Acer's warranty on dead pixels is really confusing and intricate, I'm not even sure how to determine if I meet the criteria. Will call them and update this once I find out if they will support a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: J.D.

customer_reviews.title: Came with a dead pixel
customer_reviews.text: My acer predator arrived with a dead pixel. Was told to contact acer support by amazon to get it replaced. Acer wont replace my product unless more than one pixel is damaged. For this price of product they have "24/7" support which is very limited as they didnt really help me and told me im SoL. Wouldnt recommend paying more than $300 as this should never happen to something that is so expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: A disappointment
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice monitor but lacking some colors and brightness. Also experienced an issue with horizontal lines missing from the screen. This is a know issue with the firmware of the monitor. Unfortunately the only solution is to ship is back to ACER on your own cost and get the new firmware installed and wait for them to send the monitor back. This was not acceptable so i sent the monitor back for a refund and bought an ASUS which does not have this problem.
customer_reviews.author: T. K.

customer_reviews.title: No 144hz @ 1080p!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first ever gaming monitor. I bought it specifically for the G-Sync and I can say I have not yet ever seen a screen tear! I tried to do as much research as I could, and I was surprised with one "issue": The 144Hz refresh rate is ONLY available @ 1440p. If your graphics cards is marginal and you are hoping for excellent 1080p then this is NOT the monitor for you. I didn't listen to the speakers but they probably suck...lol I hope this is helpful. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Dreythes

customer_reviews.title: Black Screen of death In under 1 year!!!
customer_reviews.text: The monitor totally dumped in less than a year. In the process now of sending it back in. For a product to crap out in less than a year says a lot about the company and products they produce. I know a lot of reviews are glowing just letting everyone know what happened to me in 9 months.
customer_reviews.author: peter

customer_reviews.title: Random vertical colored line flickering.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this monitor for 16 months now. The random vertical colored line flickering in milliseconds is still appearing since the monitor was arrived. I'm not lucky to get the perfect working condition. The first order I received has a massive bleeding but no random flickering. Not recommended for the quality monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent monitor but has some issues
customer_reviews.text: I've had 2 of these monitors for a little over a year now and they have a few flaws that drive me nuts that I have never experienced with another monitor. The first being that the power button doesn't always function properly and I am forced to either use the power switch on the back or unplug/replug the monitor all together. The second is that the monitor gets temporary burn in very often, so much that I notice my previous firefox window outlines in other applications even after firefox has been closed for a few minutes. That being said, they are decent monitors, I just probably wouldn't pay so much for them again.
customer_reviews.author: Jason albright

customer_reviews.title: Good buy after making some adjustments
customer_reviews.text: Good monitor. Bought it after much research. Pros: - 144hz IS LIFE CHANGING! - Gsync is also amazing! - Good build quality and features Cons: - Default color settings are a bit off and requires a bit of tweaking to make it look nice. (But looks amazing after that. best TN panel i have seen so far) - Overclocking above 144hz can cause a little bit of flickering. TLDR Very good monitor for gaming. 144hz and gsync is LIFE CHANGING... Needs color tweaking out of the box. but other than that no complaints
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Conti

customer_reviews.title: I was afraid it would be too big, but it's not.
customer_reviews.text: I'm a 3D modeler and I wanted to add some visual real estate to my workspace. While the XB321HK is pleasantly large, I don't find myself getting lost in the display, needing to scan to get the whole picture. I did move the monitor back on my desk only a few inches, but it's what I had hoped for. Now I have 2 HD monitors (the secondary is the 28 inch version of this model) and it's a great setup. Everything is so clear!
customer_reviews.author: Chaqui Bisquet

customer_reviews.title: Gsync... it's worth it.  This 4k monitor is really good
customer_reviews.text: Hardly any backlight bleed... No dead pixels... Really good monitor. Gsync is a God send in 4k, my rtx 2080 struggles to push 60 fps steady, g sync keeps it rock steady. It's a really cool bit of tech that i never experienced before and didn't fully understand but it's definitely worth paying extra for.
customer_reviews.author: ryan monaghan

customer_reviews.title: Good, love the G-sync. Edit: Burn-in issues.
customer_reviews.text: Very good monitor, have enjoyed its company. There have been minor issues every now and again, such as the image slightly panning to the left; a simple restart of the monitor itself fixes this issue. Going to options to disable v-sync is hilarious, but so rewarding. Edit: There has been a recent development with 16 months of use and this monitor retaining burn-ins. Please be aware this will eventually occur with this monitor despite the high price.
customer_reviews.author: Vincent

customer_reviews.title: Flickers after a year or so of use, also incompatible with many KVM switches
customer_reviews.text: What an awful way to blow $1,400. That was the retail price of this display when I bought it. After about a year it would flicker just like once an hour just for a second, not a huge deal so I dealt with it. Just this past week it has become unusable as the flickers happen every 20 seconds or so, and sometimes more frequently during games. Why this was not recalled is confusing to me, I've read so many similar accounts. I'll be contacting my credit card company if they do not honor their warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Silvashy

customer_reviews.title: Almost transformative!
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box performance is great! Games on G-Sync are buttery smooth. Haven't had time to futz with the color calibration so far, but for gaming, don't see the need. No dead pixels, easy setup and good warranty. What's not to like? (My hardware can really only push 1080p, so the resolution is not a problem for me)
customer_reviews.author: Average People

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: This monitor has a more than great image quality for gaming. The size makes it perfect for competitive gaming. I recommend to have a powerful computer in order to get the most out of it, but if you do, this is an amazing monitor. The only difference between that one the the XB3 which would be the greatest monitor, is the HDR. If you can't afford the XB3, this is probably one of the best monitor you can get for competitive gaming.
customer_reviews.author: frédéric poulet

customer_reviews.title: Great Monitor & Great Features!
customer_reviews.text: Picked this up for my son's new build and he absolutely loves it. His gaming performance as increased (according to him) and the build quality is excellent. Monitor refresh rates combined with a compatible G-Sync card really is a noticeable improvement in any gaming experience. Although there are higher resolution monitors available in larger sizes, this is perfect for twitch FPS games that require speed and visual cues in a smaller frame. I liked his so much I bought another Predator for myself, although it is a bit bigger (see Z35P).
customer_reviews.author: $partan

customer_reviews.title: If you have the money now, DO IT! If not, wait for a price drop, then DO IT!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic monitor. I justified the price, knowing I am probably going to use this monitor for at least the next 10 years. It is absolutely massive and I can run everything natively without having to scale anything in Windows which is a huge plus in my book. The color is great, and G-Sync is just the best. Best of all it totally engulfs you and has great backwards compatibility with a lot of games. If you have the money, do it! If you are really pressed for cash, maybe put the money into better hardware and get a cheaper monitor for now. And then down-the-line when this monitor goes down in price, do it.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Beasley

customer_reviews.title: Defective DisplayPort Cable
customer_reviews.text: Windows did not detect the monitor with the display cable provided out of the box. I had a spare, which is working, however there are sporadic situations where the monitor is no longer detected. I'll be trying a new cable soon. ----Update 7/14--- I asked for a refund while I still good. The monitor was beautiful when it properly detected a display port signal. However, I am not spending $1000 on a monitor that I have to reseat the cable every few days. Nor one where I spend $60 in shipping to repair. Bought a $300 monitor during the sale instead.
customer_reviews.author: Robes

customer_reviews.title: great monitor. but a lil expensive for what you get
customer_reviews.text: great color. 4k is awesome too bad its only 60hz, but its not like youre going to get much more running 1440 or higher on demanding games g sync is nice but not like crazy noticeable difference without it lots of USB ports, 3.0 as well. so thats nice
customer_reviews.author: J4CK

customer_reviews.title: Good Monitor love the Size and Resolution.
customer_reviews.text: It works great, got it tethered to a Ge Force GTX 1080. Provides smooth game play at aw-some speed. It helped improve my reaction time and reactions to events in game. Reason for the lost star is that the positioning can be out of alignment and I have to restart the monitor, don't know why but the old restart the monitor trick works, so I don't care. Vesa mounted this to an radial arm. I did have to modify the stand to hold my other monitor that was one the arm, so if you are thinking about reusing the stand for another monitor, a Drill is required.
customer_reviews.author: Eric, USA

customer_reviews.title: No bad at all for my first 1440p monitor BUT...
customer_reviews.text: Idk if it's just mine, but when I push the menu buttons on the monitor to change the picture the picture warps a little. Could be because of where the buttons are located, right down at the bottom right hand corner on the Bezel which is strange. I'll play with the monitor for the next few days and see how it goes. I'll update it in a few days. For now the monitor is great.
customer_reviews.author: Dante

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent color
customer_reviews.text: I can't seem to keep a standard color profile. Sometimes it looks good, but then other times the colors are awful and contrast is off. I've never had this issue with another monitor. I am going back to my lower res monitor just to get a good picture.
customer_reviews.author: Erebor

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic monitor! It freaked me out at first because ...
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic monitor! It freaked me out at first because it was changing colors from blue, green, red, black, and white but I figured out it was easily fixed by messing with the buttons on the monitor. The 144hz, g-sync, and 2560x1440 resolution was incredibly overwhelming for me coming from a 60hz, not g sync, and 1920x1080p. My eyes were literally watering because it was such a BIG change in gaming and I wasn't used to it. The game I tested out was Rainbow Six Siege. The monitor reviewed is the one on the right
customer_reviews.author: Cristian

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor.
customer_reviews.text: Picture is great, i have no dead pixels. G-sync is working (if that was a concern for anyone) The speakers are about what you would expect for a monitor. (I recommend using you own speakers or headphones with any monitor.) Over all no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Trey Gaskins

customer_reviews.title: Amazing. I recommend
customer_reviews.text: I was so close and burning my money on an Alienware Monitor and came across this one and have to say this is better than the Alienware one I was gonna get for a better price. This thing is probably the best purchase I made in a while!!!
customer_reviews.author: Veronica

customer_reviews.title: This monitor is amazing. The clarity is unreal
customer_reviews.text: This monitor is amazing. The clarity is unreal. I have to put my face within 3 inches of the screen to make out the individual pixels. After a little manual calibration, the colors are accurate (although the default settings are pretty good too). I'm only rocking a single gtx 970, so I won't be able to play newer games in 4k until the next gen gpus come out. Starcraft 2 runs great, and thanks to g-sync rise of the tomb raider works pretty good on medium.
customer_reviews.author: A. Devito

customer_reviews.title: Quality Panel
customer_reviews.text: Set up out of the box was great. Not very washed out, extremely minimal clouding/back light bleed. I turned the brightness down slightly and haven't messed with anything else. Plenty of options in the OSD. GSync was automatic and worked perfectly. No PWM flickering because this unit uses DC. No dead pixels. I'm very happy with this purchase after going through 4 Freesync monitors with various quality control issues. Just spend the money and get a real GSync monitor.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Roll the dice, you might get one that works...
customer_reviews.text: Dead pixel right out of the box. I rolled the dice and got burned. Nice green dot right in the middle of the screen. Merry Christmas 🙄, I read the reviews and it's a common problem. I was able to tap the dead pixel and it seemed to work. I can only hope that this will solve the issue, as I really like the monitor.
customer_reviews.author: T. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Smooth,
customer_reviews.text: Since g-sync monitors are no longer expensive, I decided to buy one to enhance my PUBG gaming experience. My rig is 6700k, gtx1070,16gb, which is good enough for 1080p, 144htz gaming. The performance of this monitor is as expected. A totally different enjoyment feeling of PUBG is given by this monitor, which 60htz, or even non-gsync 144htz gaming monitor can never provide. Love it so much and recomand those who is considering buying gaming monitors for PUBG. 1080 or higher graphic card is over killed for 1080p.
customer_reviews.author: lvmenghe

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor!
customer_reviews.text: I have had this monitor for more than 6 months now. It has been fantastic. I bought this as a second monitor to pair with an Asus ROG SWIFT PG27UQ. This monitor has worked fantastically no issues with with it. The ASUS is on RMA number two. So if you are looking at both of these monitors go with this one. Its less expensive and works a whole lot better.
customer_reviews.author: Lee R.

customer_reviews.title: 9/10 great
customer_reviews.text: Great but I didn’t even notice this for a while there’s a dead pixel in bottom left corner but it’s not notable I didn’t even about for while unless you really look hard but everything else awesome playing rainbow six on it totally worth it from 75 to 165h
customer_reviews.author: jaewon

customer_reviews.title: Nothing special, died 1 month after warranty
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor for gaming. It is a good monitor, good quality. I have enjoyed it, but it’s nothing special for that amount of money I spent on it. THEN, and 2 years and 1 month later, the monitor just died. I tried several troubleshooting things, but no picture. The warranty expires at 2 years. I am buying a LG to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Shaffer

customer_reviews.title: Don't Acer Predator XB241H
customer_reviews.text: This model has very poor picture quality as far as color/contrast. I had a dead pixel on arrival bottom right corner as well. Even if you receive one in good condition I advise to look for a newer model. I'm very pleased with my veiwsonic xg2402. Same specs but has better picture and build quality. Glad I sent this back.
customer_reviews.author: Derek S.

customer_reviews.title: When it works it’s great
customer_reviews.text: When it works the picture is great but you have to mess wit the settings on the pc and in the nvidia control panel to get it to work right and the frame rate to match. Outside of that the monitor does not turn on every time and has to be unplugged at times
customer_reviews.author: Kwisak

customer_reviews.title: Acer Predator XB271HU Abmiprz 27-inch WQHD (2560x1440) NVIDIA G-SYNC Monitor
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this monitor, the picture and resolution of this monitor is amazing, the stand is very well made a bit heavy but solid, and easy to install. G-SYNC is the icing on the cake especially when it comes to gaming I am running two video cards in SLI with this monitor and loving my gaming experience.
customer_reviews.author: The Vinman

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor, if not defective
customer_reviews.text: I returned two of these from Amazon and went and got one in store from frys. First one had a dead pixel and second one had a broken piece of plastic. If you get one thats not defective then these are great monitors. Colors dont pop very well like a higher resolution/ips but this is a tn panel and is good for gaming. High refresh rate is very nice you will notice it right away coming from 60fps.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Best monitor out there
customer_reviews.text: Expensive as heck but so worth it. Once you use one of these (or two) you are ruined for life. No other monitor will suffice again. If you game or use a PC for extended periods of time: get this monitor....Not the cheaper bigger X35....get the X34
customer_reviews.author: T Shane

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the cheapest 4k 144hz display, and it's amazing. I only had one issue: The included displayport cable gave me no signal and I had to order a vesa certified one. Apparently this is a common problem with pascal gpus. I have sli 1080 tis, one with upgraded firmware for displayport 1.3/1.4 and one without. The cable did not work on either, so I had to purchase a 20$ accel one which did the job flawlessly. I feel it's a bit harsh to take a star off simply for the cable, however it caused me a lot of panic as I had originally thought the monitor itself had been damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Gaming is nice, but the picture quality is horrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor to replace a 27" Asus IPS monitor that was running at 60 Hz for gaming. The picture quality of my IPS is very nice. I was not expecting the same with this monitor, but at least something close to my regular 24" monitors of the past. But this monitor has a washed out image and is very grainy. The colors are not vibrant at all and are very dull. The screen also seems to flicker. Has happened since I purchased it. I wouldn't recommend this one. Maybe another brand instead.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Not every monitor is created equally
customer_reviews.text: High refresh rate, IPS for wider viewing angles, color contrast is mint, and G-sync compatible. Not had any issues with screen tearing or discoloration for the past year and the best monitor I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.author: John Webster

customer_reviews.title: Smooth as butter!
customer_reviews.text: I have this monitor on my 7700k gaming rig. Its smooth as butter. Gsync feels like a cheat. Highly recommend for fast paced first person shooters. Im currently using it on PUBG and its working like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Chad C.

customer_reviews.title: Broke after less than a day of use
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this monitor, it was working well for a while, then the problem happened. The entire left half of the screen has vertical, fuzzy lines running up and done that make it look green. It flashes occasionally back to normal, but only for 2 seconds, then it flashes back. Gonna have to return and buy a different monitor.
customer_reviews.author: Rane

customer_reviews.title: Its okay..
customer_reviews.text: Just received it today. The smoothness of gaming is great with the monitor but the colors are a bit washed out; as expected from a TN panel. Didn't get any weird bugs, tearing or crazy back lights that bothered me. But I'm not quite satisfied with the color, so I might try out the IPS display instead. If you don't care about the colors/image as much, then this is probably the one for you.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannie Cen

customer_reviews.title: Totally Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: I tried using it straight out the box to test the settings. I had to make some changes but overall love it. I tried a 240hz free synch model but this one is so much better. The built quality is so much better than most monitors around the same price point. The main purpose for this monitor is to game. Which I'm so glad i choice this one. The quality of my games have improve so much and i also get to see things clearer. Games played: fortnite/overwatch/worldwarz ....Will order a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Steven v

customer_reviews.title: Great gaming monitor
customer_reviews.text: Looks great so far. The cables that came with it (power/dp were real short, so I will need to get some new ones. How to insert into the base seems a little odd. It just seems like turning it a bit left or right will cause it to pop out and fall over. Color wise it looks amazing with Farcry 5 and Elderscrolls online.
customer_reviews.author: David Edward Shapiro

customer_reviews.title: Not for Xbox one x
customer_reviews.text: Really nice monitor... not good for Xbox one x.. the monitor is limited through the hdmi it seems. It does 4K @ 60hz. When you navigate in the menu you can change the brightness and contrast however once you go into a game you cannot. I’m struggling to figure it out. I’ll most likely send it back...
customer_reviews.author: Jameson P.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pixel density
customer_reviews.text: Amazing pixel density, the IPS panel brightness is impressive (I'm currently using it on 30% and it's still borderline blindingly bright), almost unnoticeable bleed on the dark colours (only when a completely black screen is displayed), colour gamut is top quality and gamma calibration spot-on. G-sync works like a charm. The stand is very solid and keeps the screen static to an unexpectedly good extent. A bit difficult to get to the cable ports, but this is a once-off hassle and not worthy of diminishing the fabrication and design quality of the screen to any extent.
customer_reviews.author: Hennie B.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing monitor! Gsync is life changing!
customer_reviews.text: I was worried when I read all of the 1 star reviews. I was worried about receiving a monitor with factory defects like bad color temperature and backlight bleed. This monitor is perfect. From the second I turned it on and saw my desktop in 27 inches of gorgeous 2k resolution at 144hz with 1ms response time. It was a match made in heaven. I hadn’t even tested g sync out and I was in love with this monitor. But then the true bells and whistles start to show when you launch a game with a Nvidia graphics card. As Aladdin would say; “ITS A WHOLE NEW WORLD”
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Horrible image quality
customer_reviews.text: So I guess I was one of the the unlucky bunch who got a bad panel. No dead/stuck pixel but some colors are just horrible on this monitor. I can't believe I paid so much for this and the quality of the image its just terrible. Look at the terrible color banding and dithering in the attached images. I've tried every possible setting, changing HDMI, DP cables, using my pc (with a Nvidia 1080) or my PS4. I regret so much this purchase. This is the second Acer monitor that I have had an issue with. I'm done with this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Josian Acevedo

customer_reviews.title: Worth it!
customer_reviews.text: Totally worth the money. Going from a garbage monitor to the Acer Predator was such a good choice! Great picture quality for gaming and watching movies. My only problem with it is that the buikt in speakers are pretty low. Other than that, it's a great monitor!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Amazing monitor but is only 4k when using displayport not through hdmi.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Shapin

customer_reviews.title: This Predator xb271hu is Awesome! This monitor brings out the best in my ...
customer_reviews.text: This Predator xb271hu is Awesome! This monitor brings out the best in my rig! i7-7700 k GTX 1080 FTW 1440 P 144 mhz I recommend this monitor to anyone who wants to step up their game!
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: Was good for the first 2 years
customer_reviews.text: I bought this monitor on July 11, 2017, it was pretty awesome until the last few months I've noticed a vertical line in the middle of the screen! I tried searching for a solution online but found nothing. It is a good monitor but for ONLY 2 YEARS. And then you probably have to buy a new one : ).
customer_reviews.author: Meshary

customer_reviews.title: or a complete black screen like my desktop background
customer_reviews.text: I have one stuck pixel that tends to come up, but when I run a pixelated image across it multiple times at a high speed usually it goes away. I only notice it when I'm playing a dark game, or a complete black screen like my desktop background. Otherwise the picture is great, I love the multiple extra USB 3.0 Ports
customer_reviews.author: Tim Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: I play MMO style games and also some FPS and love this monitor
customer_reviews.text: Crisp bright and vivid picture. I play MMO style games and also some FPS and love this monitor. 32" really shows off the resolution. I am running a single GTX 1080 and all of my favorite games run well. Highly recommend. No light bleed that I notice. No dead Pixals. My eye strain is gone coming from a Dell 3008.
customer_reviews.author: G. M.

customer_reviews.title: The display is good, speakers are terrible and frame could be higher quality.
customer_reviews.text: Yeah... it is ok... Look at video reviews of this... The speakers are so terrible, like shockingly bad and the frame is warped apparently on all the models. TN panels kind of suck and I wish I spent another $100 and gotten an IPS panel. Also, the feet are a little much
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Tucker

customer_reviews.title: Great for CSGO
customer_reviews.text: I play a lot of CSGO and going from 60hz to 144hz I was very hesitant. I purchased the graphics card and the CPU and thought I was good to go (I wasn't). TRUST ME if you have a good graphics card that can keep around 150 fps in CSGO this is worth the purchase! The pre-set display colors are my only complaint like who the hell made them? It's baddddd.
customer_reviews.author: Conor

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this monitor
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this monitor, especially for the price. Graphics are fantastic and works great with my GTX 1080 Ti graphics card. Additionally, props to Amazon for their handing of the replacement/return as the first monitor I received had a dead pixel near the center of the screen. Replacement monitor is perfect. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Moorhouse

customer_reviews.title: Next level awesome!
customer_reviews.text: The monitor was super easy to set up and looks great on the desk. The screen was beautiful and worked wonders with my 1070 graphics card. I found that the monitor was worth every penny as it made everything look so much better. I highly recommend this to everyone looking for that extra umph in their graphics experience.
customer_reviews.author: A. James

customer_reviews.title: A God-send (No offense to religious ppl)
customer_reviews.text: No dead pixels, no back-light bleed. The screen is as smooth as a baby's butt. Very satisfied, and am glad that I bought this. Probably one of the smartest moves I've made. Oh, the G-Sync freaking rocks... the only bad thing is that now I can't go back to another monitor without adaptive sync.
customer_reviews.author: Saturn K

customer_reviews.title: Great monitor
customer_reviews.text: Upgraded my PC so finally needed to upgrade my monitor. Saw this read reviews and ordered it. When it arrived the packaging was nice, everything is fit snug in the box to prevent any moving around during shipping. The stand is tool-less took about 10 mins total to set up( that includes opening the box). Played with the settings a bit and it has various modes for gaming. G-Sync was super easy to set up with the Nvidia control panel.
customer_reviews.author: kyle price

product_meta.title: Acer Predator XB241H Bmipr 24-Inch Full HD 1920x1080 NVIDIA G-Sync Display, 144Hz, 2 x 2w speakers, HDMI & DP
product_meta.description: Style:Full HD (1920 x 1080)| Size:24-InchFasten your seatbelt: Acer's Predator XB241H Full HD display is about to turbocharge your gaming experience. This monitor combines jaw dropping specs that supports up to 180Hz refresh rate, delivering an amazing gaming experience. Tilt angle -5 degrees to 35 degrees.
feature_bullets: 24 inch full HD widescreen with 1920 x 1080 resolution. Swivel angle 30 degree
Panel technology: Twisted Nematic Film (TN) Technology
Response Time: 1ms, Pixel Pitch: 0.276 millimeter. Flicker less technology reduces annoying screen flickering that can cause eye strain when viewing the monitor for long periods
Signal Inputs: 1 x HDMI & 1 x Display Port (v1.2)
144Hz refresh rate (overclocking to 180Hz); Maximum adjustable eight :5.91 inches
Note : Dead pixels are within the normal defect variance with high resolution monitors

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.1 out of 5 stars1,033 ratings4.1 out of 5 stars
